description: Single storey rear extension (following demolition of existing rear conservatory); alteration of roof from hip to gable end; rear roof extension and installation of two roof lights to front roof slope; construction of a attached two storey House in Multiple Occupation (Use Class C3), with habitable loft space (following demolition of existing garages)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this planning permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: RA1386/01 Rev B/01, Site Plan (received 17.05.2022).

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the materials of the dwellinghouse of No. 45 Mount Avenue, Southall.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (g), 1.2 (f), 3.1 (b) of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012) and policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).
| The large house of multiple occupation hereby approved shall be limited to no more than five (5) bedrooms and ten (10) occupants.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and Policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | A minimum of five cycle parking spaces shall be provided and located in a secure undercover lockable compound, and these shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The refuse storage shown on the approved plans shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained unobstructed in perpetuity.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy SI 7 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The amenity area shown on the approved plans shall be laid out prior to first occupation of the dwellings hereby permitted and retained in perpetuity thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision of amenity space within the site in accordance with Policy 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),

- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,  - public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works in case of emergencies or complaints.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site and occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies SI1, D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses, bedrooms adjoining the communal entrance and above communal living/dining room/kitchen should be enhanced by at least 5dB above the recommended Building Regulations value. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards and noise limits of the Council's SPG10 and BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by ground or airborne vibration, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance "Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition" dated July 2014 (SPG), or subsequent guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not, without the prior written consent of the local planning authority. The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/.

Reason: To safeguard adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise, disturbance and emissions, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and policy SI1 of the London Plan (2021); and National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to occupation of the accommodation hereby approved a 1.8m high timber fence shall be erected between the rear gardens of the existing dwelling and the proposed House in Multiple Occupation and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To ensure adequate quality of amenity space within the site and to protect the living conditions and amenity of future occupants of the development in accordance with Policy D6 of the London Plan (2021)  and Policy 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
